pr_title: Dynamodb-enhanced [preview]: Added operation methods to the  client a…

timeline.message: Dynamodb-enhanced [preview]: Added operation methods to the  client and split operations into public requests and internal operations.

timeline.bodyText: Maybe this should return CompletableFuture<List<TransactGetResultPage>> for consistency. Seems to really poke out seeing it side-by-side here.
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Same comment as previous one regarding the naming of UnmappedItem.
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Can we copy parts of the operation javadocs here as applicable.
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: We should drop this annotation.
timeline.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: Should we drop it wherever it's used in the enhanced client?
replies.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText: Not necessarily, if it's a class that is likely to be re-used in different ways, and it needs to be threadsafe to be used safely with multiple threads then we should annotate. Just in this instance it seems worthless.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Nit: extraneous linebreak.
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Looks out of order, maybe place this one next to the other readBatches implementation.
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: I think we should use List here as we should (see other comment below) be controlling what implementation is used here.
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText:
This is dangerous. I think we should take a copy of their collection at this point rather than risk mutating it unexpectedly later.
this.readBatches = new ArrayList<>(readBatches);
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: I think we should use List here as I have suggested you change the Builder to do the same.
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Let's use List here.

timeline.bodyText: This can be rewritten to not suck anymore. It was only written this way due to a nuance in Java around raw type erasure, but now you've refactored it that no longer applies. We should just map it straight into requestItems.
timeline.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: What did we ultimately decide to do about this?
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: The type erasure problem no longer exists due to this refactor, therefore we should be able to do a straight map into WriteRequests
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Did we get rid of create? I think we agreed that every enhanced request should have a create(...) method that made the most sense for the most likely/simply use-cases. Eg: PutItemEnhancedRequest.create(myItem);
timeline.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: I think that one went out the window for 3 of the 4 operations. I will put it back in.
replies.author: cenedhryn

timeline.bodyText: execute?
timeline.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: oh right we haven't done GetItem yet I remember!
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.message: Dynamodb-enhanced [preview]: Transforms constructor collections into unmodifiable ones.
Dynamodb-enhanced [preview]: Moves generate request back to typed classes and updates README.
Dynamodb-enhanced [preview]: Add builder() and toBuilder() methods to ReadBatch, adds missing types to builder().

timeline.bodyText: I think we should take an immutable copy of the list value for each key.
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Can we update this to builder style?
timeline.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: Create needs to go away in fact, it doesn't have a place in the new order. Since we have a builder in this version not sure there's any justification to delay that.
replies.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: I thought we had said there would be both a builder and a create, but perhaps that was only for the requests?
replies.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText: Since one of the main drivers for removing the create is the still-to-come atomic operation split this change is deferred.
replies.author: cenedhryn

timeline.bodyText: Can we change this to builder style and get rid of create?
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Can we switch this to builder style and remove create implementation?
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Can we switch this to builder style and remove create implementation? (I don't think it has a future).
timeline.author: bmaizels

timeline.message: Dynamodb-enhanced [preview]: Removed references to internal classes in README.
